messages.title: 3 good reasons to elect Paul ...
messages.content: 1. Paul Sample is a Wiltshireman born and bred. He first came to live in Salisbury in 1974. He was educated at Bishop Wordsworth’s School. Paul and Caroline Sample have two grown-up children who live in Queens Rd, Salisbury. He is a local man for a local seat. 2. Paul Sample was a local Councillor from 1990 until 2013. He was Mayor of Salisbury in 1997-1998 and raised a record £86,500 to provide respite breaks for local people with disabilities and their carers. Everyone knows someone who has been helped by Paul. 3. Paul is the MD of The Mustard Agency in Wilton. He was the Lib Dem Leader of Salisbury District Council until it was abolished in 2009. He first stood for Parliament here in 1997. Many people think he can win on 8th June. This time Paul!

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Salisbury's local NHS is vital. Paul Sample is leading the campaign for more funding.
School budgets are being cut. Paul Sample will vote to reverse all Tory cuts to local schools.
Workers and local firms face uncertainty. Paul Sample will give you the FINAL say on the Brexit deal.
The Liberal Democrats have pledged to keep the 'Triple Lock' which guarantees your pension will keep pace with inflation.
